author: vivek
title: Dataset - Token / CNFT Analytics
description: В настоящее время данные НФТ разрознены и не имеют стандартов метаданных, что затрудняет их запрос и получение информации.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal identifies the problem of no open source tools to collect NFT metadata, which could be used to generate valuable info for NFT marketplaces which could drive more sales and transactions and ads value to the Cardano ecosystem. The key metrics in this proposal is more focused on the data it is trying to collect from NFTs and not so much on its own performance. So it is hard to compare if it is aligned with the challenge. The assumed metrics will be aligned, but it is better if the proposer states these metrics themselves to reveal more about their approach and plan for this project. The proposal is able to scale well as it will be open sourced.
f6_assessments.q1: Relevant skills and team has been provided, but no links to prove it. Leaving the voter to go do some more research. It would be great to include links in your proposal as it shows you are proud of your accomplishments and you are saving the voter the hassle of finding you online. The budget is very reasonable and broken down into identifiable items. All at the same hourly rate of $75/h. The expected completion date is 6 - 8 weeks after funding is received, which is very reasonable. They explain in great detail the type of data that will be collected and they  even go into the technical details of how it will be processed and stored and accessed.   How certain scripts would be used and so on. They haven't considered any risk/challenges. If you are not aware or prepared for risks they will slow you down when they surface.
f6_assessments.q2: They haven't provided a roadmap with milestones, but looking at the budget breakdown it's safe to  say that the different parts could be milestones, still it would help to indicate what you intend to finish at what point in time, so the community can track the progress of your project. No KPIs were provided. You can ad  user based KPIs like Github downloads, pull requests. Anything to make it easy to track the performance of your project. They identify the problem of no open source tools to collect NFT metadata and they solve this by creating an open source code repository for generating an analytics dataset from a mixture of on chain db-sync data as well as external data sources.

f6_assessments.q0:
As an active Catalyst member, funded proposer and a developer and tech person myself, I agree with the proposer that the problem statement is key to enable and facilitate the development of NFT type applications in Cardano.
By creating the Data model and the SQL Scripts, as an open source tool, other developers can enter the space more rapidly, addressing the challenge objective.
A suggestion for the proposal, will be to indicate which open source licensing model will you choose, so the community can understand the real impact this will produce.
f6_assessments.q1:
The timeline and milestones indicated are clearly defined and seems doable in my experience. The stages and content of each one indicates good knowledge of the Data Analytics space, as well as the background and skills of each of the proposers.
They are referring to the Canuckz NFT project, but no link was provided, It would've been great to be able to look at previous work and how the work.
The budget is totally reasonable, with good plan and breakdown of where it will be allocated. Even though is not indicated how many people (if others) will be working in the building of the Project, a calculation can be made out of the USD75/hs rate they indicated, totalizing 125 hs for the building, which indicates a partial dedication of at least one of the proposers.
With the above statements, it is clear that there could be some risk along the way, that are not being described in the proposal, though the timeline and methodology indicated are fitted for purpose and nothing indicates any mistrust on the information provided.
f6_assessments.q2:
The timeline provided is estimated, 6-8 weeks, and the 5 deliverables included does not include an estimated effort in each one, so  auditability could be hard, but as the proposers are showing good experience in the field, I believe those details will be provided once funded so the progress can be tracked by the community.
No KPIs where provided so they will have to be defined and measured, if funded.

f6_assessments.q0: An open-source analytics-ready dataset of Cardano NFT data that provides the community with data about the NFT space effectively addresses the challenge in my opinion.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal presented detailed bios about the team members, I would have liked to see links to LinkedIn or similar to verify. The team appears experienced and active within the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a line item budget connected to milestones. I would like the team to create a detailed roadmap connected to the milestones and budget, in this way the team can track performance vs. expenditure over time. Furthermore, I would like to see the team add measurable goals to the KPIs identified – create/model/ X number by Y date –, model 15 datasets by week 8, etc. As the proposal stands at the moment it might be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: Tool that will get data from multiple on-chain and external data sources that will provide analytics on Cardano NFT data. The proposal fits the challenge setting, providing the community with data and a way to analize it. The project will add value to the cardano ecosystem bringing understanding of the NFT data. What are the most counterfited NFTs by project and other interesting info.  The proposal will be able to scale with future growth, because it's going to be an open source project, so anyone would be able to chime in.  Currently the proposal is missing clear KPIs. As a developer, I see potential in this proposal for business driven people that need analytics to drive decision making.
f6_assessments.q1: The credentials provided are both enough to do the job presented and verifiable (i check out their linked in profiles and mateched the skills and previous experience). The two members who are going to do the implementation have all the necessary required skills to do ss in my eyes as a dev. A clear and clearly broken down budget is listed with identifiable elements that can be executed sequentially after being funded. The time table seems realistic to finish the work. The proposal shows what's the plan for the work to be done, but lacks details as to how it's going to be completed. These are highly technical people and I trust they'll have a plan in mind. My only suggestion for them would be to add a whitepaper or some kind of a technical document describing their plan for future proposals to encourage trust and credibility.  Technical aspects of the proposal could be better described even to non-technical people. No mention of challenges of buffer time was mentioned but the deliverables can be done iteratively which is a bonus. Authors have done their research on what's already out there and are building missing pieces.
f6_assessments.q2: A github repository was mentioned but not linked, which makes tracking of this project a bit harder as in their other proposal. Wish you put a link to an empty repo for future reference. No metrics or KPIs to measure the projects success. The roadmap is present and milestones are set along with a time for completion and clear deliverables.  As mentioned, the project description could be better along with the described technical solution. "would I vote for me?" this is the question every proposal should ask themselves and in this case my answer would be yes, but do better next time provide a way for the community to help you and track your progress more easily for your next proposal.

solution: Репозиторий кода с открытым исходным кодом для генерации аналитического набора данных из смеси данных цепочки db-sync, а также внешних источников данных
experience: Основатели Cardano Canucks и Canuckz NFT с 30+ летним опытом работы в области инфраструктуры данных, анализа и визуализации для предприятий.
